1.title: A New Leash on Life
1.plot: Husband-and-wife vets Dr. Will and Dr. Fran bring small town charm to metro Atlanta at each of their three animal hospitals. Dr. Will performs a procedure on a rescued Chihuahua, while Dr. Fran fights to save a kitten from injuries and hypothermia. Dr. Fran faces a potentially devastating diagnosis for a veteran's service dog, and colleague Dr. Stacy pulls more out of a terrier's ear than she expected!

2.title: Scooby Snack Attack
2.plot: Dr. Will discovers something shocking in a dog's stomach, while Dr. Fran comes to the aid of a blind retriever who was viciously attacked during her morning walk. The duo then hit the streets to rescue some feral felines before Dr. Will welcomes some adorable newborns into the world.

3.title: All Paws on Deck
3.plot: It's all in a day's work for Dr. Will and Dr. Fran as they mend bones, diagnose lumps and tend to other injured animals - until they are surprised with an emergency repair at the sports bar they own. At the end of the hectic week, the vets reminisce with loved ones over a large helping of home-style BBQ.

imdb.plot outline: LOVE AND VETS Whether it's emergency surgery on a dog that's eaten an engagement ring, a middle-of-the-night house call, or playing an owner's recorded goodnight message for one of their boarded pets, doctors Will Draper and Fran Tyler offer full-service treatment for the domestic pets and owners who call Metro Atlanta home. But running a successful vet practice while juggling the demands of a busy family life-which includes their four teens, four dogs, two cats and grandma down the street-can lead to some hairy situations. Add on top of that two popular restaurants, and life can really get hopping.
imdb.title: Love and Vets
plot: LOVE AND VETS Whether it's emergency surgery on a dog that's eaten an engagement ring, a middle-of-the-night house call, or playing an owner's recorded goodnight message for one of their boarded pets, doctors Will Draper and Fran Tyler offer full-service treatment for the domestic pets and owners who call Metro Atlanta home. But running a successful vet practice while juggling the demands of a busy family life-which includes their four teens, four dogs, two cats and grandma down the street-can lead to some hairy situations.
